fields.description:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/burndown-chart-777002653.html]

In the Documentation for Jira Software (Cloud) on Burndown charts, under "Viewing the Burndown Chart", there is an included page that is not properly displaying.

 

!Screen Shot 2018-01-31 at 10.55.33 AM.png!
fields.summary: Embedded link displays "Unable to Render {include}.  The included page could not be found."

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers reported that references to Confluence pages are now rendered as plain text.
Until recently, mentioning a Confluence page name and surrounding it on brackets would create a link to the corresponding page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In your project, set up a Project Link to a Confluence space. Set up the Space link on the Confluence side as well.
# Add in the issue description or comments a reference to an existing page surrounded by brackets [ ] like in the example below:
 !comment-test.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The link to a respective Confluence page is created.

h3. Actual Results
New comments or existing ones are now rendered as plain text, therefore there is no reference to the Confluence page.
Pasting an absolute link, or using the Wiki markup works as expected.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: References to Confluence pages are rendered as plain text

fields.description: Perhaps as a tiered system - when users have reported bugs which have been validated, the billing costs should be reduced for that users Jira instance. After all it's making your product better and possibly safer, user is putting effort into reporting so should be rewarded!
fields.summary: Atlassian product bug reporters should be rewarded with a licensing cost discount!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When exporting a workflow as XML, the first line of the generated XML file would be a blank line, followed by the XML declaration on the second line. This causes web browsers to be unable to open them, as they require the declaration on the first line of the file.
h3. Environment
 * Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export a workflow as XML
 # Open the generated XML file using a web browser

h3. Expected Results

The web browser opens the XML file correctly.
h3. Actual Results

The web browser is not able to open the XML file. Instead, it returns an error.

Chrome:
{code:java}
This page contains the following errors:
error on line 2 at column 6: XML declaration allowed only at the start of the document
Below is a rendering of the page up to the first error.
{code}
Firefox:
{code:java}
XML Parsing Error: XML or text declaration not at start of entity
Location: file:///test.xml
Line Number 2, Column 1:<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
^
{code}
h3. Workaround

Manually remove the blank first line using an XML text editor, and the web browsers should be able to open it.
fields.summary: Exporting workflow as XML results in the first line of the file to be blank

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers who are using a Non-English Language in Jira notice that the Footer of their Jira notifications are not fully translated to their chosen language

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set Language Settings in Profile (or Globally); in this test, set Profile Language to French 
# Generate a Jira notification; created a Test Issue and had "Notify Me of My Changes" enabled

h3. Expected Results
Footer of the Jira notification is fully translated

h3. Actual Results
The line suggesting to download the iOS/Android Mobile App is not translated:
{quote}Get Jira notifications on your phone! Download the Jira Cloud app for Android or iOS
Ce message a été envoyé par Atlassian JIRA (v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT#100077-sha1:0710d44){quote}

However the rest of the message is translated:
 !FrenchNotification.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Tested with German, Portuguese, and Spanish and they all have the same line in English 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Jira Notification Footer Does Not Fully Translate

fields.description:
Either have the ability to increase the size of drop down boxes and the work area of the customer portal or fix this so it's adaptive to screen resolution like a modern website.

The drop down boxes routinely cut off text if they exceed to many characters and there's no way to hover over these items to see the full text. I've hacked a way around this by modifying the CSS in the announcement banner. Screen shot attached showing issue on your own JIRA desk.

The work area of the customer portal of service desk to way too small. Why is the top bar adaptive to the screen resolution, but this work area is not? Our options on the left pane are cut off and you need to hover over them to see the full text which looks unprofessional to our customers. This is a CSS fix, but cannot be fixed by using the announcement banner like the above problem. I've attached a screen shot with the issue on one of our customer portals.
fields.summary: Window and Drop Down Box Sizes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Automation attributes activity to Inactive user if they share an email address with an Active user

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure an Automation rule to utilize "current user"
# Ensure that the current user previously has an inactive account with the same email address
# Trigger the Automation rule
# Observe the "Transitions" tab within the issue itself, and view the attributed user

h3. Expected Results
Activity should be attributed to the Active user


h3. Actual Results
Activity is attributed to the Inactive user
 
h3.Workaround
Delete the Inactive user completely from the instance
fields.summary: Automation attributes activity to Inactive user if they share an email address with an Active user

fields.description:
Customer requesting the ability to use a subdomain less than 6 characters. 

This customers company name is 4 letters and they would like to use it for their JIRA instance name.
fields.summary: Ability to use less than six characters in instance name.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When downloading the excel format for Time Tracking Report, an error occurs stating that it is not supported and it is not safe to proceed. This is being related to a previous bug report here :
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32352

In the bug report, it states that Excel exporter is deprecated. Instead. it suggests to exports the HTML report (an identical export, without a .xls suffix) which when opened by Excel, and it should provide an equivalent result.
h3. Suggested Solution

For reporting, exporting to HTML should be an option as well.
h3. Why this is important

Since Excel export is no longer supported, there should be an alternative. The excel file can still be opened for now, however, there are some users that might be concerned about security due to the error message thrown in Excel
fields.summary: Time Tracking Report with Excel View

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you select an attachment in the new Jira experience the focus on the attachment icon doesn't appear around the whole icon, it appears around part of the icon.

 

 
h3. Customer Impact
h3. Environment
 * Jira instance with the new UI

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In an instance with the new UI, open an issue which has an attachment
 # Click on the attachment icon or hit TAB until you get to it

h3. Expected Results
 # A focus style should appear on the whole attachment icon

!Focusworks.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results
 # The focus appears around part of the icon

!focusdoesntwork.png|thumbnail!

*Application logs:*
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

None so far
fields.summary: Focus style for attachments does not include entire icon in the new UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When searching for a keyword with a quote in the quick search, the search will return _No matching search results, Try using more general search terms._

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with Summary with keyword: User's
# Search for User's in the search box
h3. Expected Results
Issue with summary User's would be shown
h3. Actual Results
The search returns _No matching search results, Try using more general search terms_

h3.Workaround
Search for other keywords without the single quote.
fields.summary: Searching for keywords with as single quote (') does not return a result

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA issues calendar display error when using the Date to Display = *Change start date*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an SD project;
# Create tickets setting a date for *Change start date*;
# Configure the gadget to use *Change start date* as *Date to Display*;
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-30 at 09.54.32.png|thumbnail! 
# Error is shown when gadget saved.

h3. Expected Results
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-30 at 09.54.44.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-30 at 09.54.04.png|thumbnail! 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: JIRA issues calendar does not work with Change start date custom field

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

User wants the ability to share filters to single user, this can be helpful especially when considering external users being added to the instance and having customized dashboards specifically to them for business purposes. This can also extend to other needs
h3. *Expected Results*

To be able to share filter with a single user. 
h3. *Actual Results*

The option to share with a single user is not available. 


h3. *Workaround*

At the current state, the user will have to add the user into a group and add that group via the share filter. This would then lead to multiple groups being created, leading to a very unclean management and usage of groups in the instance. 

 
h3.
fields.summary: Allow the Filter To Be Shared With Single Users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently when having the extension redux DevTool enabled in Chrome users are having problems to load issues details.

h3. Suggestion

Support redux DevTool when Jira new experience UI is enabled.
fields.summary: Consider support of Redux DevTool extension for Chorme

fields.description:
In Jira Cloud app for Android, filters like *All, Open, Done, Created Recently, Resolved Recently, Updated Recently* come by default.

However, iOS version of the app does not have the same set of filters, as represented in the images below.
 * Android:
  !Screen Shot 2018-01-29 at 20.07.48.png|thumbnail! 

 * iOS:
  !WhatsApp Image 2018-01-29 at 8.08.23 PM.jpeg|thumbnail! 

It would be important if we had both apps containing the same filters, as they make the issue search process much easier.
fields.summary: Jira iOS app does not have all default filters

fields.description:
h3. *Issue Description*
When we comment an issue in Jira, there is the button 'Share with Customer'.

When the comment is added by a non-agent, Jira only allows this user to comment internally, but still shows the Button to share with customer.

When you try to share, does not show any error message.

h3. *Steps to reproduce:*

# Create a comment as a customer.
# Try to share the comment (as an agent)

h3. *Expected Result:*

Give an error message informing that this comment could not be shared or the button must be disabled.

h3. *Actual Result:*

No error message is shown and the button is available.

h3. *Suggested Solution:*

Show an error message or disable the button for non-agents comment.
fields.summary: Disable the 'Share with customer' button for non agents comment

fields.description: I, as JIRA Admin, would like that my purchasing dept have a button to click a link and email the entire contents of a help desk ticket to themselves. To just click a button and the full journal contents of a ticket is emailed to yourself.
fields.summary: Ability to Print out a Ticket

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

 # Create a mail handler that creates Issues of Issue Type X in a specific project, as in:
 -- "Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue"
 -- "Create a new issue from each email message"
 # Remove issue type X from the project's issue type scheme

h3. Expected result:
 The creation of issues from the mail handler will fail due to the issue type being invalid.

h3. Actual result:
 The issue is created as issue type X

h3. Notes
 It was observed that this problem may cause strange behaviors on filters like the Open Issues filter.

h3. Workaround
 Edit the mail handler or the issue type scheme being used by the project mapping the missing issue type.
fields.summary: JIRA allows invalid issue types to be created from a mail handler

fields.description:
h5. Description:
At the New Jira Experience, it is necessary 4 steps to search for issues related to a specific Assignee.

h5. Actual Status

To Search an assignee at this moment:
1. Click Quick Filter Pulldown
2. Scroll to find the Assignee
3. Check the Assignee
4. Click out of Quick Filter Pulldown

h5. Suggestion:

Just type the name of the assignee as used to be before New Jira Experience.
fields.summary: Search for Assignee using Quick Filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When we have a specific set of characters in summary in some issues, it breaks saved filter results containing these issues, showing a blank page when it should show the issue quick view. *These characters are invisible when viewing the summary*

Strangely enough, *it doesn't happen when we do a regular JQL search*, even using the same JQL search as the affected filter, only when opening a saved filter.

Filters using affected filters (using filter="affected filter") are also affected.

The characters in summary were decoded to hex and are the following: {{e2}}, {{80}} and {{a8}} together.

Here's a file with the characters followed by a capital C:
[^characters]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with a summary containing the characters:
#* To make it easier, here's a JSON file, formatted to create an issue via REST containing the character.
[^create_issue.json]
#* Notice that there's a space in 'summary' field. Those are the characters causing problem
#* Update project and issue type ID in JSON file to match an existing project and an issue type that's part of that project's Issue Type Scheme
#* Use this to create an example of issue:
{code}
curl -D- -u user:password -X POST --data @create_issue.json -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue
{code}
# Create a filter containing the issue and save it (must be saved to replicate)
# Open filter in 'Detail View' (you won't replicate otherwise)

h3. Expected Results

The filter opens correct.

h3. Actual Results
Page shows blank:
!blank_filter.png|thumbnail!

This shows in JS Console:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot set property 'table' of undefined
    at Object.JIRA.Issues.GlobalIssueNavCreator.readInitialData (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_operational=true&simplifiedUxOptinAvailable=true:9306)
    at HTMLDocument.<anonymous> (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_operational=true&simplifiedUxOptinAvailable=true:11816)
    at j (batch.js?locale=en-US:76)
    at Object.fireWith (batch.js?locale=en-US:77)
    at Function.ready (batch.js?locale=en
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Running 'xxd' in a file containing the affected characters followed by a C character (copied from an affected summary), we can see this:
{code}
xxd test6
00000000: e280 a843 0a                             ...C.
{code}

0x43 (67 in decimal) is C in ascii table and 0A (10 in decimal) is line feed (so a new line), so {{e280 a8}} are the invisible characters. In fact, if you create a file with 'C' alone, it shows everything but those 3 characters:
{code}
00000000: 430a                                     C.
{code}

There's some public knowledge about it:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10556875/list-of-unicode-characters-that-should-be-filtered-in-output

You may be able to find summaries with non-ASCII characters (including those), using this:
{code:sql}
select id, summary from jiraissue where not summary ~ ( '^('||
 $$[\09\0A\0D\x20-\x7F]|$$||               -- ASCII
 $$[\09\0A\0D\xA1-\xFF]|$$||               -- ASCII ext
 ')*$' );
{code}

h3.Workaround
Edit all affected issues, by removing the characters.
fields.summary: Some characters in summary break saved filters

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JQL auto-complete does not use custom field ID if two custom field IDs exist with the same name

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two custom fields with the same name.
# Create a JQL and try to auto-complete with the desired custom field.

h3. Expected Results

The auto-complete will add the field ID because there are two fields with the same name

h3. Actual Results

It only shows the custom field name and it shows an error saying that the operator is not supported by the field

h3.Workaround

# Manually type the cf[XXXXX] form of the custom field
# Use different names for different custom fields
fields.summary: JQL auto-complete does not use custom field ID if two custom field IDs exist with the same name

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Once you move an issue to another project and move that issue back to the old project. The issuekey will not be the same as it was at first. And if you perform a CSV import mapping the issuekey using the old issuekey of that issue. The issue with that old issue key will be updated instead of a new issue be created with the issue key referenced in the CSV.

h3. Suggested Solution
Verify the current issuekey of the issue when importing issues. If current issuekey doesn't match with the one referenced in the CSV, a new issue should be created with that issuekey.

h3. Why this is important
If you have many issues moved across the projects and If you're looking to import new issues from the CSV, instead of creating the issues, the CSV importer could update old issues that shouldn't be updated.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: CSV importer shouldn't use the old issue key as reference when mapping the issue key.

fields.description:
h3. On the Jira new Interface, after you delete a project it still shows up as a Recent Project. Then when you click on the link from Recent Projects, show that this project it was deleted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Switch to Jira New Interface (in case needed).
# As Jira admin select Settings > Projects.
# Then Delete a project which is appearing on recent Projects.

h3. Expected Results

The project references should be completed deleted.

h3. Actual Results

The project still remains on the Recent Browsed Projects List.

When clicking on the link, it shows that the Project it was deleted.
 
h3.Workaround
So far there is no Workaround.
fields.summary: Deleted Project remains in Recent Projects List

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Some errors  regarding DVCS integration is showing on the URL instead of the page. There should be a proper page displaying the error itself as most users missed it. It will be great to have better visibility of the error so that users can try to self diagnose the problem.

!Screen Shot 2018-01-29 at 10.50.00.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: DVCS integration errors should show a proper error screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It is a problem when a user is trying to double-click on a word and another box appears to edit the description field instead. This can be viewed by :
 # Turning on Labs in profile
 # Start a print
 # Select an issue in a sprint
 # A new screen would appear and the Description field would be above with no title stating what it is.
 # Try to double-click on a word so you can copy and paste, but a new box would appear to just edit.
 # This is quite troublesome for users
 # !Description Field.PNG|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution

Following back the old UI, There is a pencil icon beside the field. The pencil function should be implemented here so it would give more flexibility for the user to edit or not edit.
h3. Why this is important

Saves a lot of time and hassle from doing this, and it is clearer to users as well.
h3. Workaround

To not see this view, just head to your :
 # Profile
 # Go to the bottom of the screen and turn off Labs
fields.summary: Selected Issue View Detail through Active Sprint

fields.description:
The doc [Hosting outside of the U.S. - Managed Hosting and European Cloud BETA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeval/other-atlassian-evaluator-resources/hosting-outside-of-the-u-s-managed-hosting-and-european-cloud-beta] has information links regarding the signup to beta, however, this isn't available anymore. 

The information to signup to the beta should be removed to not cause confusion to our customers.
fields.summary: Documentation with a wrong link

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you have a *field must not be empty* validator, and that field is not filled when cloning it , the process bar won't progress, but won't show any error message either.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *validator* in the *Create* transition that makes a field value needed (not empty);
 # Try to clone a issue that was created before the validator was created.

h3. Actual Results
The cloning process just won't progress.

h3. Suggestion
The clone won't happen, but there should be a message explaining the issue.
fields.summary: Cloning process will get stuck if a field that needs to be filled (validator rule) is not, but it won't notify anything.

fields.description:
Ability to configure JIRA to Dutch language.
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-26 at 09.13.36.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Support for Dutch Language

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The problem is that the *assigned to me gadget* right now only displays issues with no resolution in the issue

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a filter in the assigned to me gadget which would make things easier for users to look and the current issues which are being assigned to them

h3. Why this is important
This saves loads of time at the same time simplifying the users' work
fields.summary: Have a Filter in the "Assigned to me gadget"

fields.description:
*Summary*

Currently, when user access Jira from Jira mobile app they won't be able to see Display created and updated date.
fields.summary: Display created and updated date in Jira issue mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There's no layout for fields in Create Issue screen and all the fields are being listed vertically in a single column. While in Issue View screen (issue details page), the fields are nicely organized.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to customize the fields layout in Create Issue screen
fields.summary: Ability to customize layout in Create Issue screen

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When uploading an image using *ctrl+v* from clipboard to a large project, it will take around 15 seconds for it to be upload. While on other smaller project, it is much faster. Example, project that has many issues and have many attachments in it

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Upload an attachment by pasting it from clipboard to a large project. 
# The image takes a long time to be uploaded, we can't click *Upload* button as it is greyed out and not clickable:
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Uploading the same image to a smaller project, it takes a shorter time for the *Upload* button to be clickable.

h3. Expected Results
* The *Upload* button should be clickable quickly.

h3. Actual Results
* The *Upload* button is greyed out for around 10-15 seconds(depending on the project's size) before it is clickable.
fields.summary: Uploading attachment by Ctrl+V(paste) to large projects is slow

fields.description: I, as JIRA user, would like to have the function startOfSprint(), where I could search for changes or updates in issue since the start of the sprint.
fields.summary: Create an startOfSprint() JQL Function

fields.description:
h3. Summary When a user tries to enter a default value in HTML formatting into the field *Message Custome Field (edit) and Single User Picker*, it does not change it anything in the edit screen. The second thing is when the user goes back to the default value to edit it : # Edit Default Value ** *hello* # Edit the Default Value again **

hello

# If we re-edit again, it would be like this ** !Capture.PNG|thumbnail! # Single User Picker shows this !Single User Picker.PNG! h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a custom field - Message Custom Field(edit) and SIngle User Picker # Edit the Default Value of the field and the description of the field # Edit using any HTML value ** hello # Then make sure the field is placed on your project/issue # Edit an issue # The value of the field will be shown as above (hello) h3. Expected Results The value should change into bold formatting. h3. Actual Results The bold formatting does not work and it will remain as of how it has been typed out. h3. Workaround The only workaround as of now is to use wiki markup style for Message Custom Field # Example ** hello world to *hello* h3. Workaround There is no workaround for single user picker
fields.summary: Message Custom Field (edit) & Single User Picker wiki markup not functioning properly

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When trying to share a filter, no option is displayed

h4. Steps to reproduce*

# Navigate to *Issues > Manage filters*
# Click in *more(...) > Edit filter details*

h4. Expected Results
Share filter options are displayed

h4. Actual Results
No options are displayed under *Shares*
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-25 at 9.19.02 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Workaround
* If it is possible, temporarily disable the new UI
fields.summary: Unable to share filters

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When going to the manage add-on section and clicking on the "upload add-on" you will see a "Learn More" button there, however, when clicking there you will be redirected to a [non-existing FAQ documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/resources/faqs.html].

 !Screen Shot 2018-01-25 at 8.26.13 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Go to a Jira cloud instance
# Click on "settings" > "Add-ons" > "Manage Add-ons"
# You need to change your settings to show the button upload add-on, click in settings right beside "Audit log" and mark the option "Enable development mode"
# Next, click on the upload add-on button and when clicking on the "Learn more" button you will be redirected to a non-existing FAQ section.

h3. Expected Result

Be redirected to an actual guidance page.

h3. Workaround

[Contact support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/].
fields.summary: Learn more button in the upload add-on section is redirecting to an out of date documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Boards with profile location does not appear to other users on mobile apps

h3. Environment
* Mobile apps

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board shared with a project (accessible for all users) and set its location to a user profile, for example, user "A"
# Using a different user, user "B" for example, access Jira using a mobile app (Android or iOS)
# Tap "Projects" on the mobile app

h3. Expected Results
The board option is visible to tap on

h3. Actual Results
The mobile app does not display the board's name on the list
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
* Set the board's location to a project
fields.summary: Boards with profile location does not appear to other users on mobile apps

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Sometimes when doing a bulk operation you need to see the issues summary in order to comprehend what is the case and not bulk edit the wrong issue.

h2. Suggestion

Add the ability to expand the summary column as it fit, in order to see the full text on the ticket.

 !Screen Shot 2018-01-25 at 7.09.41 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to stretch the summary column in the bulk edit view

fields.description:
Reorder transition buttons using {{opsbar-sequence}} in the properties, change the order for the workflow button in the issue view.
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-25 at 16.23.45.png|thumbnail! 

On the other hand, it doesn't change the order of the actions list.
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-25 at 16.25.45.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Reorder transition buttons in the actions list

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Trying to add a field in an Agility project may throw a 500 error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Agility project.
# Try to add a custom or system field using the *Where's my field?* option:
 !where-is-my-field.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on any of the provided suggestions, Screen configuration, Screen Scheme or Issue Type Screen Scheme.

h3. Expected Results
As Agility projects are a simplified way to create projects, the message should be different, not suggesting to the users that they can access the screen schemes to edit it.

h3. Actual Results
If you click on any of the suggestions you will get a 500 error with the following exception:
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.scope.IllegalScopedEntityArgumentException: Illegal Entity Scope for Entity class (SCREEN). Expected entity scope 'GLOBAL' but has scope 'PROJECT'
{code}
 
h3. Notes
- The exception may vary between {{SCREEN}}, {{SCREEN_SCHEME}} or {{ISSUE_TYPE_SCREEN_SCHEME}} depending on which option is selected.
- The *Where's my field?* helper is misleading because it can lead to a misunderstanding that Agility projects can be customized in the same way as Software or Business projects.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Trying to add a field to an Agility project may throw a 500 error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the description has the Horizontal ruler, it's not possible to edit the description in the issue detail view. It appears as the markup below.
{code:java}
----
{code}
h3. !Description.png|thumbnail!

!EditDescription.png|thumbnail!

h3. Customer Impact

h3. Environment
* Core boards
* Software boards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new issue with a description that contains this horizontal ruler (----) in the description
 # In a Business board open the issue details view for the issue created above
 # Click to edit the description

 [^720p-resized.mov] 

h3. Expected Results
It should be possible to edit it

h3. Actual Results
The description disappears.

 *Application logs:*

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
Remove the Horizontal ruler (----) from the description to be able to edit in the board's issue detail view
fields.summary: It's not possible to edit description in the detail view when it has a horizontal rule

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA mail handler fails to create issues from email when the email is sent by a JIRA Service Desk customer, when Default Reporter is set in the mail handler.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a software and a service desk projects
 # Create a mail handler:
 ** Associate it to JIRA default mail server
 ** Set it to create issue in the software/business project in the previous step
 ** Set a Default Reporter (a user with permissions to create issue in software project)
 # In service desk project, add a customer
 # Using the customer in step 3, send an email to the mail handler in step 2

h3. Expected Results
Mail handler creates issue with reporter set as the Default Reporter

h3. Actual Results
Mail handler fails to create issue and following JIRA logs are thrown:
{noformat}
2018-01-25 08:49:20.119	INFO	com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler	No Issue found for email '<email-subject>' - creating a new Issue.
2018-01-25 08:49:20.119	INFO	com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler	Issue Key not found in subject '<email-subject>'. Inspecting the in-reply-to message ID.
2018-01-25 08:49:20.130	INFO	com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler	No Issue found for email '<email-subject>' - creating a new Issue.
2018-01-25 08:49:20.130	INFO	com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler	Issue Key not found in subject '<email-subject>'. Inspecting the in-reply-to message ID.
2018-01-25 08:49:20.130	WARN	com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.internal.vertimail.VertimailPushMailHandler	Cannot handle message as destination project has not been configured.
2018-01-25 08:49:20.155	ERROR	com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.rest.IncomingMailResource	Mail handler com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.internal.vertimail.VertimailPushMailHandler failed to process email to <mail-handler-email-address> at: 2018-01-25T08:49:20.155Z
2018-01-25 08:49:20.155	ERROR	com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.rest.IncomingMailResource.privacy-safe	Mail handler com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.internal.vertimail.VertimailPushMailHandler failed to process email at: 2018-01-25T08:49:20.155Z
2018-01-25 08:49:20.155	WARN	com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.internal.vertimail.VertimailPushMailHandler.privacy-safe	Unable to process email. All handlers failed.
2018-01-25 08:49:20.155	WARN	com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.internal.vertimail.VertimailPushMailHandler	Cannot create issue due to invalid license: [Sorry, you can't create any issues right now, as you need to have access to a Jira application to be able to create issues. To gain application access you need to be a member of a group assigned to an application.]
{noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA mail handler fails to create issues from email sent by JSD customer

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, the limit for bulk operation is 1,000 issues. When a user tries to perform bulk update of 1,000 issues, the bulk operation will hit into timeout and fails.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for more than 1,000 issues.
# Bulk edit 1,000 issues

h3. Expected Results
* The bulk operation should complete successfully.

h3. Actual Results
* The bulk operation will fail with timeout error

h3. Workaround
* Perform the bulk operation in a smaller batch, ~500 to ~700 issues have a high chance of succeeding.
fields.summary: Bulk Operation for 1,000 issues will timeout

fields.description:
When on my boards backlog view, I have to scroll through whole backlog, grab task from the bottom, scroll with this task up until TODO section is visible, and after that I can drop the task into TODO section. It should work like on screenshot on the bottom. Also no backlog sorting by priorities.

!Selection_009.png!!Selection_008.png!
fields.summary: Backlog and ToDo sections scrolling UX

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Whenever customer configure "Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body" on email handler, the CC assignee option does not work
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create email handler for "Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body"
 # Create issue
 # Comment on issue
 # Reply the comment via email and cc a user

h3. Expected Result

CCed user should be assignee
h3. Actual results

Nothing happens
h3. Workaround

currently none
fields.summary: Using Mail handler "Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body" does not respect CC assignee

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Events/Entries started to have this as ID {{<id>urn:?streamsSourceProduct=jira</id>}}. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Get activities by doing a GET on https://mySite.atlassian.net/activity?maxResults=10&providers=issues

h3. Expected Results
Unique IDs for entry. Used to be in the form of {{urn:uuid:66c95d7b-c54a-3849-ad40-1b105536fe97}}

h3. Actual Results 
ID values of some are {{urn:?streamsSourceProduct=jira}}

h3. Notes
Used to work for last 18 months. Experienced this issue recently.
fields.summary: Jira activity stream IDs are non-unique and mostly <id>urn:?streamsSourceProduct=jira</id> for entries

fields.description:
Previously, JIRA Ticket fields would directly flow to fill the full width of a browser window, which would let users arrange their browser orientation to their own workflow. This was particularly useful in larger format monitors (like 2k or 4k monitors)

Custom Fields are heavily affected by this particular functionality change, since the available width of custom fields is smaller, adding additional layers of difficulty to viewing all of the relevant information at once.
fields.summary: Allow for width control of the JIRA Issue View in the new JIRA UI

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0} 

^Last Updated:^ ^25 Jan 2018^   

This issue get fixed when fixing the other bug related to Business project boards [JRACLOUD-68620|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-68620]

{panel}



h3. Summary

In a business project, when I try to view an issue by clicking through the board interface the screen that shows up is *not friendly at all* after clicking on the comment field. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to a board on a business project
# click on an issue to view it
# The screen that shows up will change position and provide a non friendly UX once clicking on the field to add a comment.

h3. Expected Results
* The screen that shows up to view the issue does not change to a non friendly UX when clicking the comment field 


h3. Actual Results
* Half the screen does not show up.

 !Half the screen disappeared.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Developer tools console does not show any specific error.

h3.Workaround
Currently no workaround to avoid this happening.
fields.summary: Non friendly UX when trying to comment an issue through a business board

fields.description:
OAuth documentation [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-oauth-authentication/] mentions “Authorization: Bearer

{access_token}“ as an example of how to Pass the OAuth access token through the header
 
 This information is incorrect as “Authorization: Bearer \{access_token}
 
 “ only works for OAuth 2.0 and the supported version in Jira For REST API is OAuth 1.0 as stated in the same document.
 
 The *e.g. “Authorization: Bearer \{access_token}* must be removed from [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-oauth-authentication/]
fields.summary: Remove e.g. "Authorization: Bearer" from OAuth page

fields.description:
Currently, the documentation available for REST API calls using OAuth as authentication method is this one: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-oauth-authentication/

This document provides a sample of OAuth client code and an example of how to use it to run a GET request to Jira. This sample OAuth client only makes GET requests.

It'd be nice to have sample code that allowed to perform POST, PUT, DELETE
In addition, some examples of how to run these calls
fields.summary: Provide more examples of REST API calls using OAuth

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The user is not being able to edit the filter details on the new UI.

h3. Environment
Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the *Manage filters* page
# Click on the 3 dots on the filter you want to edit and select the *Edit filter details* option

h3. Expected Results
A pop up should be displayed to allow you to edit the details of the filter

h3. Actual Results
A spinning wheel appears on the page and nothing happens.
The below exception is thrown in the console of the browser:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'i18n' of undefined
    at HTMLDocument.eval (eval at <anonymous> (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:69), <anonymous>:5:36)
    at j (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:76)
    at Object.add (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:76)
    at init.ready (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:63)
    at new init (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:62)
    at Function.j [as $] (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:59)
    at eval (eval at <anonymous> (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:69), <anonymous>:2:17)
    at eval (<anonymous>)
    at batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:69
    at Function.globalEval (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:69)
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Disable the new UI (if the option is available)
fields.summary: Unable to edit filter details in the new UI

fields.description:
Problem
Jira doesn't have reports regarding all users assigned to an issue.

Suggestion
I am looking to extract a report that will list of all the users previously and currently assigned to a ticket between Created Date and Due Date.
fields.summary: Allow reports regarding all users assigned to an issue

fields.description: I, as JIRA user, would like to search and create a list with all labels that we are using.
fields.summary: Ability to Create an List with All Labels

fields.description:
I, as JIRA Administrator, would like to have the ability to disable the Export option for some users (for example  for external users).
We don't want that all have access to this feature.
fields.summary: Ability to disable export feature

fields.description:
I do not want people start an issue without a remaining estimate. So the Transistion should perform a *validation*. But there is no option to validate these field "> 0"? I have with "Field Required Validator" the possibility to check if it is empty. But i need empty OR 0.

At the *conditions* there is the possibility with "Value Field". But that does not help. Now the button for the transition is missing but nobody knows why.

I need the same check at *validation* to give some feedback of the field is empty or 0.
fields.summary: [Workflow] Validator: check "remaining estimate" = 0 (keyword "Value Field")

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the Application Navigator, even if you limit the access to Confluence for confluence-user group and Jira for jira-software users. When the user logs into Confluence application of the instance, in the Application Navigator the Jira option is still viewable, of course if you click on it the user is brought to the default Jira page which doesn't allow you to access anything but the user is not supposed to view this option in the first place. This works properly on the Jira side, if you limit the Confluence access to confluence-user only group, the application navigator from Jira side does not list Confluence as an option anymore. 

 

Environment

This happens in both Old and New Jira Experience App Switcher.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Application Navigator setting, set the Jira access to Jira only users group and set the Confluence access to Confluence only users group.
 # Login to a customer with Confluence only access > Open the Application Switcher and you will still be able to view the Jira option. 

 

!app.png|width=897,height=210!
h3. !confluence.png|width=284,height=646!
h3.  
h3. Expected Results

Under "Apps", Confluence access only user should only see Confluence option. 

 
h3. Actual Results

Under "Apps", Confluence access only user can still view the Jira option.
fields.summary: App Switcher still shows JIRA option for Confluence only user.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As of now, all data contains in the table will be vertically aligned to center 
|ab|cd|

|ab
ab|cd|

|ab
ab
ab|cd|

|ab
ab
ab
ab|cd|

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good if Jira have the text formatting to set the line in the column to either at the top or bottom as below
 !table.JPG|thumbnail! 
h3. Why this is important
The current text formatting in Jira is very limited
fields.summary: Ability to format cell/table to aligned to to top/bottom

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Users getting "Something has gone wrong" when attempting to login

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Login to Jira Cloud to see the error

h3. Expected Results
* Able to login successfully

h3. Actual Results
* The following error is seen:
 !Something.Wrong.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* None

h3.Workaround
* None
fields.summary: Users getting "Something has gone wrong" when attempting to login

fields.description: With the new JIRA UI, a new modal pops up whenever a user clicks on the "Browse" link to attach a file onto an issue. Since not all users utilize Dropbox or Google Drive, this extra step takes additional time and can potentially cause issues with any external integrations an instance may use.
fields.summary: Disable additional modal when uploading attachments in issues

fields.description: AS a User of Jira for projects, I often add multiple sub tasks at the beginning of a project, then find I do not need all of them. It would be an incredible time saver if I could delete these from the sub-task context menu vs having to first navigate to the sub-task, then deleting the sub-task, then trying to get back to the main task I was working on.
fields.summary: Delete Sub Tasks from Primary Task

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to attach files to board issues using IE 11 in the old JIRA UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to JIRA and navigate to any board that is configured.
# Choose an issue from the board
# Navigate to full detail issue
# Click Browse or '...' -> Attach Files


h3. Expected Results

File browser should come up and allow you to attach files.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing on the screen happens.  In the console only the following is thrown as an error:

{noformat}
SCRIPT5: Access is denied.
{noformat}
 

h3.Workaround

* Use another browser, such as Google Chrome or Firefox
* Use the new JIRA experience
* Use the quick view from the JIRA card '...' instead of the full detail view.
fields.summary: Unable to attach files to board issues using IE 11 in the old JIRA UI.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If you attach two or more files with the same filename, subsequent files will come with a hash included in the filename, like {{filename(hash).extension}}
 !filename.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Suggested Solution
Add a simpler unique identifier to differentiate these files, like {{filename.001.extension}}

h3. Why this is important
The hash is added to differentiate multiple files with the same name, however, it is hard to identify the versioning of the files.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Simplify the versioning when there are two or more attachments with the same filename

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Wrong description is displayed for issue priority if the user's language is not the instance's default.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a priority with name *Blocker*
# Add a description
# Change your profile language
# Open https://<YOUR INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/secure/ShowConstantsHelp.jspa?decorator=popup#PriorityLevels
#* You'll see "Blocks development and/or testing work, production could not run." instead of the description you set

h3. Expected Results
The value set for description is shown no matter the language set on user's profile.
Or, the value set on translation is displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The default description is displayed.
 
h3. Notes
This is not reproduced will all priorities.

h3.Workaround
Add a translation for the impacted priority
fields.summary: Wrong description is displayed for issue priority
Unable to share filters - page stuck

fields.description:
*Summary*
 When trying to edit a filter details, the user can't edit filter details.

*Steps to reproduce*
 1. Navigate to All filters page (filters view)
 2. Click in ... for the filter you want to edit

*Expected Results*
 A pop up will appear to edit the filter details.

*Actual Results*
 A spinning wheel appears *forever* and the below exception is thrown in the console of the browser:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'i18n' of undefined
    at HTMLDocument.eval (eval at <anonymous> (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:69), <anonymous>:5:36)
    at j (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:76)
    at Object.add (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:76)
    at init.ready (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:63)
    at new init (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:62)
    at Function.j [as $] (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:59)
    at eval (eval at <anonymous> (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:69), <anonymous>:2:17)
    at eval (<anonymous>)
    at batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:69
    at Function.globalEval (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:69)
{noformat}
*Workaround*
 * Press 'ESC' when the spinning icon appears and try again
 * If it is possible, temporarily disable the new UI
fields.summary: Edit filter details keeps a spinning icon on the screen

fields.description:
In case users change their usernames, these users lose permission to see their private filters.

They can only edit the owner in case it is a shared filter.

It should be good if at least administrators could be able to edit these private filters to the new username.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to manage filters owned by inactive users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The *Manage add-ons* section and the *Find new add-ons* section won't load in Safari 11.0.2 (13604.4.7.1.6).
 
After clearing the cache/cookies and logging in again, those pages will load correctly , but after you go to another page and get back to them, the issue will show up again.

It happens on both Old and New UI.

* This is how the pages look like:
 !not loading2.png|thumbnail! 

 !Not loading.png|thumbnail! 

* I've noticed some errors in the console:
!error log2.png|thumbnail!  

!error log.png|thumbnail! 

{quote}
This one in the new UI
 !error log3.png|thumbnail! 
{quote}

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 Go to the *Manage add-ons* or the *Find new add-ons* section by any available path.

h3. Expected Results
The *Find new add-ons* section will show add-ons available in the market place.
The *Manage add-ons* section will load the installed add-ons.

h3. Actual Results
No content is loaded on neither of the pages.

h3. Workaround

Using another browser, e.g. Google Chrome.
fields.summary: Manage add-ons and Find new add-ons not loading in Safari 11.0.2 (13604.4.7.1.6)
Update Creating release notes documentation

fields.description: The current output of the filter count gadget needs a huge amount of space for very little information. It would be great to have the option to switch to a more compact view, needing less horizontal space. Two counter should be on the same row when using the three column dashboard layout.
fields.summary: Provide a more compact view of the filter count gadget

fields.description:
In Jira is possible to restrict access, for the users, to some features/functions on the application, however, the links, buttons, options are still present in the UI.

Would be usefull if these links, buttons, options were hidden if the user can't access it.
fields.summary: Hide links that the user don't have access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to choose which panels will appear in the issue detail view.
There is only the defaults: comments, attachments, sub-tasks, development.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Ability to let the user choose which panels to show, for example, if they have Zendesk or another add-on.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Customize which panels will appear in the new issue detail view

fields.description:
{panel:title=Resolved|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#000000|titleBGColor=#a7e8f7|bgColor=#e2f7fc}
A fix has been deployed to all instance and verified that the issue is fixed. Please retry to see if the fix works for your end. You might be required to clear the browser cache in order for the fix to take place. 
{panel}
----
*Summary*
When viewing a business project board, the user can scroll up and down to see all issues. When the user clicks in any issue of this board, then the user close the issue and is back in the board, it is no longer possible to scroll up or down.

*Steps to reproduce*
1. Navigate to a business project board
2. Click in an issue
3. Close the issue
4. Try to scroll up or down

*Expected Results*
The page will scroll up or down.

*Actual Results*
The page doesn't scroll at all.

*Workaround*
Refresh the page, then it is possible to scroll again.
fields.summary: Not possible to scroll business board after clicking in an issue

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

In the drop-down list of the permission scheme when granting permission to a specific "Group" , if there are too many group entries with the same group name, the drop-down will not be able to list the required group that you desire. For example, if you tried to search group "user" and you have multiple group named a-user, b-user, c-user and so on. The list will be limited to the alphabetical descending results in the drop-down. The list is also limited to only show 20 out of the total groups. Therefore, you won't be able to pick the "user" group at all. 

 
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create multiple groups with similar names, (user, a-user, b-user, c-user, etc..)
 # Make sure the total number of groups following the above criteria is above 20.
 # Now, go to a permission scheme > Click on Edit on any permission > Choose "Group" > On the column, type "user".
 # The list will only consist the first 20 results alphabetical from a-user all the way to the last result, which will not consist of "user".

 

Screenshot:

!error-part-1.png|width=782,height=442!

!error-part-2.png|width=781,height=429!

 
h3. *Expected Results*

When user enters the group name, drop-down list does provide the required group when searching. 
h3. *Actual Results*

Drop-down list does not provide the exact group name.

 
h3. *Workarounds*

Type the group name with caps lock for the first letter, for example for the group "users", search with "Users", the results comes out.
fields.summary: Group name is not listed in drop-down list if there are too many similar entries

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User is prompted with below error when viewing Jira Coreboards after associating a different workflows for each issue types
{quote}
Hm... don't see your work here?
Don't worry, your issues are still safe and sound. You can't see them here because your current project is not configured to use boards. Learn more about [configuring your business projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-boards-803604008.html] for boards.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a business projects
# Add more issue types on the business project that you have created (If needed)
# Create a test issue for each issue types
# View the Jira Coreboards and you will all the issues that you have created
# For each of issue types in the business project, associated it with a different workflows *with exactly the same status and transitions configured*  and publish the workflows
# View the Jira Coreboards again and you will be prompted with the error 

h3. Expected Results
The error message should explain more e.g cause of the issue or how to fix the issue instead of the current error message that we are seeing

h3. Actual Results
User were prompted with the following message
 !bug.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Getting error message: "Hm... don't see your work here?" when trying to view Jira Coreboards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It is not possible to scroll when opening a JIRA issue.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to any issue that has several comments
2. Check that there is no scroll bar.

h3. Expected Results

It should be possible to scroll when accessing the issue

h3. Actual Results

Scroll is not working (neither mouse, nor keyboard)

_Application logs:_

The following errors can be seen in console:

{code}

Failed to install inline edit blur handler for request participants field, JIRA.Components.IssueEditor.InlineEditUtils is missing

{code}

and

{code}

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'KBSmartSearch' of undefined

{code}

 !Scroll_issue_console_error_1.png|thumbnail!  !Scroll_issue_console_error_2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround  

Switching to new Jira UI works fine
fields.summary: It is not possible to scroll when viewing Jira issue

fields.description: Creating a new custom field similar to Epic Link to be able to setup any kind of linking with other issue type, and be able to search on it.
fields.summary: Creating a new custom field similar to Epic Link to be able to setup any kind of linking

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to comment using the activity stream gadget in JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to JIRA and view your dashboard.
# Click comment under an issue or space update in the Activity Stream.
# After writing comment, click add.

h3. Expected Results

Comment added to issue or Confluence page.

h3. Actual Results
You either receive the error:

The activity you were trying to comment on is inaccessible or has been deleted.

Also seeing this have a continual spin trying to load and not displaying the above error.

Logs show: Logged an error while posting comment: DELETED_OR_PERMISSION_DENIED
 
Reproduced locally.

h3.Workaround
Open the respective issue of the activity stream gadget and make the comment through the issue view or Confluence page.
fields.summary: Error when comment via the Activity Stream
Error when comment via the Activity Stream

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * As a Jira administrator I want to change the value of *autowatch own issues* but find myself changing the *Default outgoing email format value* without noticing.
 * The Default outgoing email format value changes automatically from html to text.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to System > under User Interface > User Default Settings
 2. Check that Default outgoing email format is set to html
 3. Click edit default values in order to switch *Autowatch own issues* value from yes to no
 4. See that Default outgoing email format has been switched to "text"
h3. Expected Results:
 * The value shown in the *email format* +select list+ is the same as the value *Default outgoing email format* screen.

h3. Actual Results
 * The value shown in the *email format* select list is: text
 * However the value shown in the *Default outgoing email format* in first screen is: html

h3. Notes
 * This behavior occurs only when first editing the default values. so to test it, *you need to create a new test instance*.
 * This is important because someone can follow the public documentation to change the value of *Autowatch own issues* but he finds himself changing the *Default outgoing email format* without noticing.
fields.summary: Default outgoing email format value changes automatically
Error 404 While accessing Dashboard
Error 404 While accessing Dashboard
Error 404 While accessing Dashboard
Error 404 While accessing Dashboard
Error 404 Whilse accessing Dashboard

fields.description:
I, as JIRA Admin, would like to visualize where my instance is stored.
For example, I would like to confirm if may data is in a storage in Europe or America.
fields.summary: Visualize Instance Server Location

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Several instances are experiencing the error 404 while loading a Dashboard using the New Jira Experience. Intermittent issue.

h3. Environment
* Vertigo with ADG3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Open any Dashboard using New Jira Experience. (ADG3)
2. Open browser Dev tools
3. See Network and Console tabs

Getting the Error below


{noformat}
There is 404 (Not Found) error for GET https://crocha.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user/properties/onboarding.adg.version?username=xxxxxxxx method.
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
Load the Page without errors.

h3. Actual Results

h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
If possible, deactivate the *New Jira Experience*
fields.summary: Error 404 Whilse accessing Dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Description

When the user changes it profile avatar, at first it seems to work, after the 15, 20 minutes, the picture is lost and the default one returns.
 

h3. Workaround

Apparently, there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Avatar Changes are Lost After Time

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For German language, delete confirmation message is shown in English.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to _Your Profile_ name.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa
 # Edit _Preference_
 # Select language German and Update
 # Open an issue
 # Select Delete 

h3. Expected Results

Delete confirmation message is shown in German.
h3. Actual Results

Delete confirmation message is shown in English.

!image__2_.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: For the German language, delete confirmation message is shown in English

fields.description:
*Summary*

The following documentation should be improved outlining the exact steps customers need to perform to import only their attachments to Jira cloud.

Also, it would be good if we could warn customers that they can split the file and perform the import in parts so it won't timeout.

- https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/how-to-import-only-part-of-a-jira-export-into-jira-cloud-859461966.html
fields.summary: Improve import attachments documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Enable JQL filter for _Worklog_ webhook events.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a webhook as follows
#* Issue related events
#** JQL: {{project = <PROJECTKEY>}}
#** Worklog: created, updated, deleted
# Log work in an issue from a project *different* than the one specified in the JQL.

h3. Expected Results
The webhook shouldn't be fired.

h3. Actual Results
The webhook was fired.
 
h3. Workarounds
* [substitute desired viarable|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/webhooks/#variable-substitution-in-the-webhook-url] in the webhook URL to listen from events from individual issues or projects
* implement filtering of events in the webhook listener
fields.summary: Enable JQL filter for Worklog webhook events.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Enable JQL filter for _Attachment_ webhook events.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a webhook as follows
#* Issue related events
#** JQL: {{project = <PROJECTKEY>}}
#** Attachment: created, deleted
# Add an attachment to an issue from a project *different* than the one specified in the JQL.

h3. Expected Results
The webhook shouldn't be fired.

h3. Actual Results
The webhook was fired.
 
h3. Workarounds
* [substitute desired viarable|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/webhooks/#variable-substitution-in-the-webhook-url] in the webhook URL to listen for events from individual issues or projects only
* implement filtering of events in the webhook listener
fields.summary: Enable JQL filter for "Attachment" webhook events

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After a Jira import from Cloud or Server, not all user accounts are created and require to manually create them after import.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a Jira import from Server or Cloud.

h3. Expected Results
All user accounts are properly created after import.

h3. Actual Results
Some user accounts are missing after import randomly. No error thrown.
 
h3.Workaround
Recreate the missing users after import.
fields.summary: Jira import not creating all user accounts
People page menu on Project Empty
PSQLException: ERROR: relation "public.AO_4AEACD_WEBHOOK_DAO" does not exist

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 28 February 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We believe that we have addressed any outstanding problems with comment notifications for the official [*Jira Cloud app for Slack*|https://slack.com/apps/A2RPP3NFR-jira-cloud].

We are aware that there are some cases where customers are not receiving comment notifications and still using the legacy [*Jira Server Alerts*|https://slack.com/apps/A0F7YS3MZ-jira-server-alerts] app. This app is maintained by Slack and is intended for use with Jira Server. We have notified Slack of this issue with comment notifications for customers using this app with Jira Cloud and will collaborate with them to ensure it is updated. However, the fastest (and recommended) way to address the issue is to install the official [Jira Cloud app for Slack,|https://slack.com/apps/A2RPP3NFR-jira-cloud] as a replacement.

Thanks for your patience while we investigated this issue.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
Jira Product Management
{panel}

h3. Summary

When a comment is made on a JIRA issue, the [Jira Cloud for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.slack/cloud/overview] integration isn't generating a new notification on Slack channels. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect a project to a Slack channel 
# On the section *Send a message to the channel when*, mark the *Someone leaves a comment* checkbox: 
**  !someone leaves a comment.png|thumbnail! 
** Leave a comment on any JIRA issue registered on the connected project


h3. Expected Results

A new notification should show up on the Slack channel:

 !comment added.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Slack will not receive any notification regarding the comment being registered on the JIRA issue. 

h3. Notes

When inspecting the JSON payload that is sent when a comment is made (using the [Connect inspector|https://connect-inspector.prod.public.atl-paas.net]), the comment body is registered on the {{comment_created}} and {{jira:issue_updated}} events correctly.
fields.summary: Comment_created events are not generating notifications on Slack

fields.description:
Currently, the background color of the Jira's board is white by default and it is not editable.

The customers are asking for the ability to customize the background color of the Jira's boards.
fields.summary: Ability to change the background color of the boards

fields.description:
h3. Description

When the user opens an Issue Creation Popup and attaches a file, nothing is displayed and the _Create_ button does not work until all attachments have finished uploading.
h3. Reproduce
 # Create a new issue via an Issue Creation Popup, using C key.
 # Attach a file that takes some seconds to be uploaded (1-2mb enough).
 # Click the _Create_ button before the uploaded files have finished.

h3. Current result

Nothing happens and the user does not see the uploading progress.
h3. Expected result

When attaching something to an issue, the uploading progress should be visible to the user. Also, if the user clicks the _Create_ button, the issue might dim and disable the issue edition until the uploads have finished and autocreate on attachments have been uploaded.
fields.summary: Show uploading progress in issue creation popup

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Admins are able to map a screen to the "create" transition on a workflow

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Open any workflow. You should be able to map a screen to the "create" transition.

h3. Expected Results
* You should only be able to map a screen to the "create" transition/operation when editing the screen scheme (where you have the create/edit/view operations to map screens).

h3. Actual Results
* Admins can also map a screen to the "create" transition when editing a workflow. JIRA will automatically ignore the screen configured on the workflow and will use the screen configured in the "create" operation on the screen scheme. When viewing all the screens (gg -> screens), the name of workflow which has the screen mapped to its create transition will be blank.

 !Create screen bug.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround(s)
* Unmap the screens on the "create" transition of the workflows.
fields.summary: Admins able to map a screen to the "create" transition on a workflow

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the second paragraph, under 'Things you should know', 'licence' should be 'license'.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Go to Site administration > Site settings > Self Signup > Right hand side > under 'Things you should know' > second paragraph > 'licence (UK)' should be 'license (US)'.
fields.summary: Typo in Self signup page under 'Things you should know'

fields.description: I, as an Jira Admin, would like to remove the "Escalate" and "Share" option from the Customer Portal and only allow it internally, not to customers.
fields.summary: Option to Remove Escalation and Sharing from Customer Portal
